title: Expert warns substandard coal could cripple Norochcholai Plant
byline: Energy expert Dr. Vidura Ralapanawa has warned that the continued use of substandard imported coal at the Lakvijaya (Norochcholai) Power Plant could severely damage its generators and boilers, posing a serious threat to the country’s power supply.

title: Railway crossing near Kiriwandala to close temporarily for repairs
byline: The main railway crossing on the High Level Line at Mile 35, Chain 30, between Puwakpitiya and Avissawella on the Kelani Valley Railway Line will be temporarily closed for repairs from March 5 until March 8 .

title: Stanford develops universal nasal vaccine for flu and colds
byline: Scientists at Stanford University say they are developing a single nasal spray vaccine that could protect against coughs, colds, flu, and even dangerous bacterial lung infections. Early research in animals suggests the spray may also reduce allergic reactions, including asthma triggered by dust mites.

title: National World Wildlife Day celebration to be held at Yal
byline: The national celebration of World Wildlife Day will be held on March 3 at the Lunugamvehera area of Yala National Park, organized by the Department of Wildlife Conservation.

title: Ranchi-Delhi air ambulance with 7 on board crashes in Jharkhand’s Chatra
byline: An air ambulance flight from Ranchi to Delhi crashed on Monday evening in Jharkhand’s Chatra district, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said.

title: Documentary on Sri Lanka crisis honoured at Jalgaon film festival
byline: The acclaimed Pulitzer Center-supported documentary ‘Democracy in Debt: Sri Lanka Beyond the Headlines’ will receive two awards at the Second Jalgaon International Film Festival in India this year, for ‘Best Social Film’ and ‘Best Screenplay’, reports a press release.

title: Oxford Union apologises to Namal for not allowing him to talk
byline: While apologising to Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser Namal Rajapaksa for not being able to proceed with his address to the Union, the Oxford Union has informed Namal that it had been rescheduled for a future date so that the lecture could be delivered without compromising the safety of the attendees.

title: Construction of Jaffna International Cricket Stadium temporarily halted
byline: Construction work on the first international cricket stadium in the Northern Province has been temporarily suspended due to the absence of an Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) report.

title: UEFA suspend Benfica’s Prestianni after alleged racist abuse
byline: UEFA on Monday suspended midfielder Gianluca Prestianni from Benfica’s Champions League play-off second leg against Real Madrid this week after he was accused of racially abusing Vinicius Junior.

title: West Indies smash Zimbabwe with 254-6 to shake up Super Eights Points Table
byline: The West Indies blew away T20 World Cup surprise packages Zimbabwe by a colossal 107 runs in Mumbai on Monday as Shai Hope’s team opened their Super Eights campaign with a dominant victory.

title: Trump renews attack on US Supreme Court, vows other tariffs, licenses
byline: President Donald Trump renewed his condemnation of the U.S. Supreme Court on Monday after it ruled against his sweeping tariff program last week, vowing to turn to other tariff powers and licenses but giving no details.

title: Afghanistan to take on Sri Lanka in white-ball series
byline: The white-ball series features three ODIs and three T20Is and gets underway from March 13.

title: LAUGFS gas confirms continued LPG supply amid temporary distribution constraints
byline: LAUGFS Gas PLC has assured the public that uninterrupted supply of its branded LPG cylinders will be maintained despite temporary market constraints.

title: UK government quietly updates passport rules for dual citizens — again
byline: British and Irish dual nationals may be able to use their expired British passports, along with a valid second passport, to enter the United Kingdom under new temporary measures — but only at the discretion of airlines and other carriers.

title: Powerful winter storm shuts schools, disrupts travel across US Northeast
byline: Children across parts of the U.S. Northeast will stay home on Monday as a powerful winter storm forced school closures and pushed offices and transit systems onto emergency schedules, with officials across the region warning of heavy snow, strong winds and dangerous travel conditions.

title: Railway service disruption causes major public hardship, Warns Station Masters
byline: The Sri Lanka Railway Station Master’s Union (SLRSMU) has criticized the current railway administration for causing severe hardship to the public due to poor planning in restoring services after Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Customs union signals possible disruptions over delayed promotions
byline: The Customs Trade Union Alliance comprising the Customs Staff Officers’ Association, the Senior Customs Superintendents Association, and the Customs Officers Association has warned of potential work stoppages if longstanding delays in promotions and salary adjustments are not addressed immediately.

title: Highest temperature of 33.9°C recorded in Mattala
byline: A maximum temperature of 33.9 degrees Celsius was recorded at the Mattala Meteorological Station today (23), the Metrology Department said.

title: Over 10,000 cyclone-affected people assisted as food security improves: WFP
byline: More than 10,000 people affected by Cyclone Ditwah received assistance in January 2026 as food security conditions showed signs of improvement, according to the latest Country Brief issued by the World Food Programme (WFP).

title: Govt. committed to easing parents’ education burden: Dr. Kaushalya Ariyaratne
byline: Deputy Minister of Mass Media Dr. Kaushalya Ariyaratne said the government is committed to easing the heavy financial burden faced by parents in educating their children.

title: Rev. Dr. Kirinde Assaji awarded lifetime achievement honor by KITT University
byline: Ven. Dr. Kirinde Assaji, Chief Incumbent of Gangaramaya Temple, has been conferred the prestigious Lifetime Achievement Award by KITT University in recognition of his exceptional contributions to Buddhist scholarship, spiritual leadership, and the strengthening of Sri Lanka–India cultural relations.

title: Coal in ninth shipment too found to be of low quality: Sajith
byline: Coal in the ninth shipment has been found to be of inferior quality as per real-time data, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Allegations of inferior quality coal are true: Lal Kantha
byline: While admitting the allegations on inferior quality coal, Minster of Agriculture Lal Kantha said today there has been no fraud or corruption behind the coal supply tender.

title: Deadline extended for public complaints over CMC corruption probe
byline: The deadline for submitting public complaints and information to the Presidential Commission of Inquiry to investigate into alleged acts of corruption, fraud, criminal breach of trust etc. has been extended until 16 March 2026.

title: MP Amarakeerthi case: Families of 12 death-row convicts seek President’s intervention
byline: Relatives of the 12 men sentenced to death over the killing of former MP Amarakeerthi Athukorala and his police security officer staged an appeal outside the Presidential Secretariat this morning, urging the President to intervene.

title: Mirissa and Bentota among Asia’s Top Beaches by Tripadvisor
byline: Sri Lanka’s Mirissa Beach and Bentota Beach have earned spots among Asia’s most celebrated coastal destinations, according to the 2026 Travelers’ Choice Awards Best of the Best Beaches list released by Tripadvisor.

title: Kim Jong Un re-appointed leader of North Korea’s ruling party
byline: North Korea’s ruling Workers’ Party has again chosen Kim Jong Un to be its general secretary, state media report.

title: 81-year-old sits O/L Maths exam to critique education system
byline: Nimal Silva, an 81-year-old resident of Kiriberiya, sat for the G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) Mathematics examination—not merely as a personal achievement, but to send a strong message to the government about the state of the national education system.

title: 31,000 houses to be built under Home Development Programme
byline: A total of 31,000 houses will be constructed under the Home Development Programme, marking a significant step towards improving housing facilities and uplifting the living standards of low-income communities.

title: Ayodhya temple delegation arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: A delegation led by Kailashanand Giri ji Maharaj, the chief priest of the Shiva Temple in Ayodhya, India, arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport this morning (February 23) for a special visit.

title: Customs officers launch black armband protest over promotion delays
byline: The Customs Trade Union Alliance said that customs officers will commence a symbolic trade union action from today (24 February) by performing official duties while wearing black armbands across all customs offices in the country.

title: Probe underway after illness kills 72 tigers in Thai tourist park
byline: Authorities in Chiang Mai, a city in northern Thailand, are investigating the deaths of dozens of tigers at a popular tourist attraction this month.

title: Sri Lanka names new Ambassadors to Ethiopia and Iran
byline: The Committee on High Posts of Parliament has approved the nominations of two Heads of Mission and a Ministry Secretary.

title: Closure of Mas Holdings factories could be blow for economy: Sajith
byline: Closure of two factories belonging to Mas Holdings could be a blow to the Sri Lankan economy as 26,000 people will lose their employment as a result, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Former Police Inspector arrested over Weligama shooting in 2023
byline: Former Police Inspector Jagath Nishantha, wanted in connection with a shooting near a prominent hotel in Weligama on December 31, 2023, has been arrested.

title: State of Play:  Equation for teams in race for semis at T20WC
byline: After an exciting group phase, eight teams - the Super Eight - remain in contention for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026 crown.

title: A long-awaited reform: Understanding Sri Lanka’s proposed rescue, rehabilitation and insolvency law
byline: Sri Lanka has long recognised the need to modernise its insolvency framework, yet meaningful reform has remained in the pipeline for years.

title: Defence Secretary inspects Neville Fernando Hospital under SLAF management
byline: Following the recent Cabinet decision to hand over the management of the Dr. Neville Fernando Teaching Hospital (NFTH) in Malabe to the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF), Defence Secretary Sampath Thuyacontha paid an official inspection visit to the hospital yesterday (23 February).

title: National World Wildlife Day celebration to be held at Yala
byline: The national celebration of World Wildlife Day will be held on March 3 at the Lunugamvehera area of Yala National Park, organized by the Department of Wildlife Conservation.

title: Ranchi-Delhi air ambulance with 7 on board crashes in Jharkhand’s Chatra
byline: An air ambulance flight from Ranchi to Delhi crashed on Monday evening in Jharkhand’s Chatra district, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said.

title: Sri Lanka pushes for Middle East nuclear-weapon-free zone at UN talks
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath, addressed the High-Level Segment of the Conference on Disarmament (CD) in Geneva on 23 February, reaffirming the country’s firm commitment to global disarmament and multilateral cooperation.

title: Trump’s new tariff comes into effect at lower than expected rate
byline: US President Donald Trump’s new global tariffs have come into effect at 10% despite a pledge to introduce them at a higher rate.

title: Communist Party raises concerns over coal fraud
byline: The Communist Party of Sri Lanka added its voice to the growing public outcry in response to the unfolding revelations surrounding the coal procurement scandal. These revelations have, once again, exposed the deep rooted corruption embedded within the neoliberal governance framework that has dominated the country’s economic management for decades, according to a statement from the party.

title: Railway Trade Unions oppose cut to disaster loans for employees
byline: The Railway Department has reportedly taken steps to reduce the disaster loan amount granted to railway employees, sparking strong opposition from trade unions.

title: Cabinet approves ground and cargo handling contracts for SriLankan Airlines in Paris
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the award of Passenger Handling and Ground Handling Services, as well as Cargo Handling Services contracts for SriLankan Airlines at Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.

title: Portugal Foreign Minister meets Vijitha Herath
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs of Portugal, Paulo Rangel, met Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath this morning.

title: Three envoys present credentials to President
byline: Three newly appointed Ambassadors-designate presented their Letters of Credence to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat today (24).

title: Over US$ 2 Mn penalty on substandard coal shipment – Minister
byline: The first coal shipment, containing 59,831 metric tons, was found to be below the required calorific value standard and a penalty of approximately US$ 2.07 million was imposed, Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Sri Lanka face must-win clash against New Zealand in Super Eight showdown
byline: Sri Lanka will be desperate to correct their course when they take on New Zealand in a crucial Super Eight encounter of the T20 World Cup in Colombo on Wednesday.

title: Full fixtures for ICC Women’s T20 World Cup 2026 unveiled
byline: Twelve sides will compete in the 10th edition of the ICC Women’s T20 World Cup starting June 12.

title: Committee appointed to review coal supply to Norochcholai Power Plant
byline: The Ministry of Energy has appointed a seven-member committee to evaluate the current coal supply mechanism to the Norochcholai Lakvijaya Power Plant, the Ministry said in a statement.

title: New Governor of Southern Province sworn in
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed Professor Susiripala Manawadu as the new Governor of the Southern Province.

title: Woman fined Rs. 1,000 for filming father giving evidence before court
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today imposed a fine of Rs. 1,000 on a female suspect who pleaded guilty to video recording on her mobile phone, her father giving evidence from the dock when he appeared before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court in connection with a case.

title: Former Trade Secretary arrested over Mahapola Lottery corruption
byline: Former Secretary to the Ministry of Trade, Priyanka Madduma Bandara, has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), the Commission said.
